##

CVE-2024-39929
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T18:31:46

4 posts

Exim through 4.97.1 misparses a multiline RFC 2231 header filename, and thus remote attackers can bypass a $mime_filename extension-blocking protection mechanism, and potentially deliver executable attachments to the mailboxes of end users.

1 repos

https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2024-39929

tienelle@mendeddrum.org at 2024-07-17T08:51:17.000Z ##

So, Exim has a vulnerability (CVE-2024-39929) which lets a slightly malformed e-mail bypass the "We don't accept .exe or .zip files here" filter. That's definitely a security problem! But.

Why is it assigned a score of 9.1, "Critical"? I'd expect something with that kind of score to involve something like RCE or misdirecting mail, not bypassing a fairly simple-minded filter that will only ever be one layer of your security.

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-07-16T09:40:02.000Z ##

1,5 million de serveurs de messagerie Exim affectés par une faille de sécurité ! https://www.it-connect.fr/des-millions-serveurs-messagerie-exim-faille-de-securite-cve-2024-39929/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Messagerie #Linux

##

CVE-2024-38081
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T18:18:38.713000

2 posts

.NET, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-07-26T03:03:02.115Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories are in. See the parent toot above for the original Google Chrome blog post. The already disclosed CVE IDs go from 6988, 6989, 6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005 (16 total with no additional information). Then you have two new ones:

  • CVE-2024-38103 (5.9 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-39379 (7.0 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

These are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, and exploitation less likely. Also note that CVE-2024-38095 (7.5 high, disclosed 09 July 2024) .NET and Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability and .NET, .NET Framework, and CVE-2024-38081 (7.3 high, disclosed 09 July 2024) Visual Studio Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability received minor updates to add or remove additional vulnerable software.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38103 #CVE_2024_39379 #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-26T03:03:02.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories are in. See the parent toot above for the original Google Chrome blog post. The already disclosed CVE IDs go from 6988, 6989, 6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005 (16 total with no additional information). Then you have two new ones:

  • CVE-2024-38103 (5.9 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-39379 (7.0 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

These are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, and exploitation less likely. Also note that CVE-2024-38095 (7.5 high, disclosed 09 July 2024) .NET and Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability and .NET, .NET Framework, and CVE-2024-38081 (7.3 high, disclosed 09 July 2024) Visual Studio Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability received minor updates to add or remove additional vulnerable software.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38103 #CVE_2024_39379 #CVE

An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in AirPods Firmware Update 6A326, AirPods Firmware Update 6F8, and Beats Firmware Update 6F8. When your headphones are seeking a connection request to one of your previously paired devices, an attacker in Bluetooth range might be able to spoof the intended source device and gain access to your headphones.

CVE-2024-21412
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.30%

updated 2024-06-11T15:16:02.980000

12 posts

Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/lsr00ter/CVE-2024-21412_Water-Hydra

ai_workspace@social.mikala.one at 2024-07-28T01:12:43.762Z ##

網路捷徑檔案安全機制繞過漏洞遭到利用超過一年，攻擊者用於散布數種竊資軟體 | iThome

Link
📌 Summary:
微軟在今年2月例行更新中修補了網路捷徑檔案安全繞過漏洞CVE-2024-21412，但駭客卻利用這項漏洞來散布多種竊資軟體，攻擊範圍涵蓋北美、西班牙和泰國。資安業者Fortinet在分析中發現，攻擊者製作指向特定遠端伺服器的惡意URL檔案，並在受害電腦下載LNK檔案，誘使受害者執行該檔案，從而推進攻擊。研究人員看到駭客使用兩種不同程式碼注入工具來繞過防禦，最終在受害電腦植入竊資軟體。

🎯 Key Points:
1. 微軟在今年2月修補了網路捷徑檔案安全繞過漏洞CVE-2024-21412，但駭客利用它散布竊資軟體。
2. 資安業者Fortinet發現，攻擊者製作指向特定遠端伺服器的惡意URL檔案，並誘使受害者執行以推進攻擊。
3. 研究人員看到駭客使用兩種程式碼注入工具，最終在受害電腦植入竊資軟體。
4. Fortinet發現，駭客利用Steam社群網站作為Dead Drop Resolver來埋藏C2來源。

🔖 Keywords:
#CVE-2024-21412
#Fortinet
#Water Hydra
#Lumma Stealer
#Meduza Stealer
#ACR Stealer
#PowerShell
#HTA指令碼
#Edge主程式圖示
#LNK檔案
#forfiles
#mshta
#Imghippo
#GdipBitmapGetPixel
#HijackLoader
#Steam社群網站
#Dead Drop Resolver
#Docker
#AuthZ
#OpenAI
#GPT-4o mini
#Meta Llama 3

##
ai_workspace@social.mikala.one at 2024-07-28T01:12:43.762Z ##

網路捷徑檔案安全機制繞過漏洞遭到利用超過一年，攻擊者用於散布數種竊資軟體 | iThome

Link
📌 Summary:
微軟在今年2月例行更新中修補了網路捷徑檔案安全繞過漏洞CVE-2024-21412，但駭客卻利用這項漏洞來散布多種竊資軟體，攻擊範圍涵蓋北美、西班牙和泰國。資安業者Fortinet在分析中發現，攻擊者製作指向特定遠端伺服器的惡意URL檔案，並在受害電腦下載LNK檔案，誘使受害者執行該檔案，從而推進攻擊。研究人員看到駭客使用兩種不同程式碼注入工具來繞過防禦，最終在受害電腦植入竊資軟體。

🎯 Key Points:
1. 微軟在今年2月修補了網路捷徑檔案安全繞過漏洞CVE-2024-21412，但駭客利用它散布竊資軟體。
2. 資安業者Fortinet發現，攻擊者製作指向特定遠端伺服器的惡意URL檔案，並誘使受害者執行以推進攻擊。
3. 研究人員看到駭客使用兩種程式碼注入工具，最終在受害電腦植入竊資軟體。
4. Fortinet發現，駭客利用Steam社群網站作為Dead Drop Resolver來埋藏C2來源。

🔖 Keywords:
#CVE-2024-21412
#Fortinet
#Water Hydra
#Lumma Stealer
#Meduza Stealer
#ACR Stealer
#PowerShell
#HTA指令碼
#Edge主程式圖示
#LNK檔案
#forfiles
#mshta
#Imghippo
#GdipBitmapGetPixel
#HijackLoader
#Steam社群網站
#Dead Drop Resolver
#Docker
#AuthZ
#OpenAI
#GPT-4o mini
#Meta Llama 3

##
ai_workspace@social.mikala.one at 2024-07-28T01:12:43.762Z ##

Link
📌 Summary:

Link
📌 Summary:
微軟在今年2月例行更新中修補了網路捷徑檔案安全繞過漏洞CVE-2024-21412，但駭客卻利用這項漏洞來散布多種竊資軟體，攻擊範圍涵蓋北美、西班牙和泰國。資安業者Fortinet在分析中發現，攻擊者製作指向特定遠端伺服器的惡意URL檔案，並在受害電腦下載LNK檔案，誘使受害者執行該檔案，從而推進攻擊。研究人員看到駭客使用兩種不同程式碼注入工具來繞過防禦，最終在受害電腦植入竊資軟體。

🎯 Key Points:
1. 微軟在今年2月修補了網路捷徑檔案安全繞過漏洞CVE-2024-21412，但駭客利用它散布竊資軟體。

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T14:02:43.074Z ##

Fortinet: Exploiting CVE-2024-21412: A Stealer Campaign Unleashed
FortiGuard Labs has observed a Meduza and ACR stealer campaign spreading multiple files that exploit CVE-2024-21412 (8.1 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to KEV Catalog same day; Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability) to download malicious executable files. Fortinet describes the infection chain and provides a technical analysis. IOC provided.

#threatintel #infostealer #meduza #acrstealer #IOC #CVE_2024_21412 #eitw #activeexploitation #kev

Fortinet describes the infection chain and provides a technical analysis. IOC provided.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T15:25:30.626Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr

##

CVE-2024-4835
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-24T01:15:30.977000

2 posts

A XSS condition exists within GitLab in versions 15.11 before 16.10.6, 16.11 before 16.11.3, and 17.0 before 17.0.1. By leveraging this condition, an attacker can craft a malicious page to exfiltrate sensitive user information.

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-25T08:20:43.876Z ##

GitLab Releases Critical Updates to Address XSS Vulnerability

Date: July 25, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5067
Vulnerability Type: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
CWE: [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]], [[CWE-264]]
Sources: GitLab Critical Patch Release, Security Online Info, CERT-EU

Synopsis

GitLab has released critical updates for its Community Edition (CE) and Enterprise Edition (EE) to address multiple vulnerabilities, including a high-severity cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw.

Issue Summary

On May 24, GitLab released new versions of GitLab Community Edition (CE) and Enterprise Edition (EE) with crucial bug and security fixes. These updates address a significant vulnerability, CVE-2024-4835, with a CVSS score of 8.0, which allows attackers to take over accounts via an XSS flaw. Exploiting this through the VS code editor (Web IDE), an attacker can create a malicious page to steal sensitive user information. User interaction is required, This does increase the attack complexity. All versions of GitLab CE and EE up to 16.10.6, versions 16.11 up to 16.11.3, and versions 17.0 up to 17.0.1 are affected. Patches are released by GitLab: 17.2.1, 17.1.3, 17.0.5

Technical Key Findings

The XSS vulnerability (CVE-2024-5067) is exploited through the Maven Dependency Proxy, where attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in the user's session. This flaw has a CVSS score of 7.7, indicating high severity.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 16.6 up to 17.2.1
  • Specific vulnerabilities affect versions 17.1 prior to 17.1.3 and 17.2 prior to 17.2.1

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to arbitrary code execution, potentially compromising user accounts and leaking sensitive information.

Patches or Workarounds

GitLab has released patches in versions 17.2.1, 17.1.3, and 17.0.5. It is strongly recommended that all installations be upgraded to these versions immediately to mitigate the risk.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5067 #XSS #SecurityUpdate #Vulnerability #Patch #Cybersecurity

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-25T08:20:43.000Z ##

GitLab Releases Critical Updates to Address XSS Vulnerability

Date: July 25, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5067
Vulnerability Type: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
CWE: [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]], [[CWE-264]]
Sources: GitLab Critical Patch Release, Security Online Info, CERT-EU

Synopsis

GitLab has released critical updates for its Community Edition (CE) and Enterprise Edition (EE) to address multiple vulnerabilities, including a high-severity cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw.

Issue Summary

On May 24, GitLab released new versions of GitLab Community Edition (CE) and Enterprise Edition (EE) with crucial bug and security fixes. These updates address a significant vulnerability, CVE-2024-4835, with a CVSS score of 8.0, which allows attackers to take over accounts via an XSS flaw. Exploiting this through the VS code editor (Web IDE), an attacker can create a malicious page to steal sensitive user information. User interaction is required, This does increase the attack complexity. All versions of GitLab CE and EE up to 16.10.6, versions 16.11 up to 16.11.3, and versions 17.0 up to 17.0.1 are affected. Patches are released by GitLab: 17.2.1, 17.1.3, 17.0.5

Technical Key Findings

The XSS vulnerability (CVE-2024-5067) is exploited through the Maven Dependency Proxy, where attackers can inject malicious scripts that run in the user's session. This flaw has a CVSS score of 7.7, indicating high severity.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 16.6 up to 17.2.1
  • Specific vulnerabilities affect versions 17.1 prior to 17.1.3 and 17.2 prior to 17.2.1

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to arbitrary code execution, potentially compromising user accounts and leaking sensitive information.

Patches or Workarounds

GitLab has released patches in versions 17.2.1, 17.1.3, and 17.0.5. It is strongly recommended that all installations be upgraded to these versions immediately to mitigate the risk.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5067 #XSS #SecurityUpdate #Vulnerability #Patch #Cybersecurity

CVE-2024-34359
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:12:23.490000

2 posts

llama-cpp-python is the Python bindings for llama.cpp. `llama-cpp-python` depends on class `Llama` in `llama.py` to load `.gguf` llama.cpp or Latency Machine Learning Models. The `__init__` constructor built in the `Llama` takes several parameters to configure the loading and running of the model. Other than `NUMA, LoRa settings`, `loading tokenizers,` and `hardware settings`, `__init__` also load

LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-07-24T10:38:20.000Z ##

Is that the most critical security vulnerability (in 2024) in LLM infrastructure ecosystem? Attackers can escape LLM chat to execute arbitrary code on the affected system. https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-34359

CVE-2024-27348
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-02T14:50:57

2 posts

RCE-Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server.This issue affects Apache HugeGraph-Server: from 1.0.0 before 1.3.0 in Java8 & Java11 Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.3.0 with Java11 & enable the Auth system, which fixes the issue.

CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.77%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T14:58:41.894Z ##

Recorded Future: TAG-100 Uses Open-Source Tools in Suspected Global Espionage Campaign, Compromising Two Asia-Pacific Intergovernmental Bodies
Recorded Future identifies a Russian government-aligned influence network, tracked as TAG-100 targeting global government and private sector organizations. TAG-100 has compromised organizations in at least ten countries across Africa, Asia, North America, South America, and Oceania. TAG-100 exploited internet-facing devices and open-source Go backdoors Pantegana and SparkRAT post-exploitation. The campaign compromised two Asia-Pacific intergovernmental organizations and targeted multiple diplomatic and trade entities. TAG-100 conducted reconnaissance and attempted exploitation of CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS Command Injection Vulnerability) against dozens of US-based organizations. IOC provided. Direct link to 14 page PDF

#threatintel #TAG100 #cyberespionage #russia #CVE_2024_3400 #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-16T14:58:41.000Z ##

Recorded Future: TAG-100 Uses Open-Source Tools in Suspected Global Espionage Campaign, Compromising Two Asia-Pacific Intergovernmental Bodies
Recorded Future identifies a Russian government-aligned influence network, tracked as TAG-100 targeting global government and private sector organizations. TAG-100 has compromised organizations in at least ten countries across Africa, Asia, North America, South America, and Oceania. TAG-100 exploited internet-facing devices and open-source Go backdoors Pantegana and SparkRAT post-exploitation. The campaign compromised two Asia-Pacific intergovernmental organizations and targeted multiple diplomatic and trade entities. TAG-100 conducted reconnaissance and attempted exploitation of CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS Command Injection Vulnerability) against dozens of US-based organizations. IOC provided. Direct link to 14 page PDF

#threatintel #TAG100 #cyberespionage #russia #CVE_2024_3400 #IOC

CVE-2023-43976
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-04-04T08:11:36

2 posts

An issue in CatoNetworks CatoClient before v.5.4.0 allows attackers to escalate privileges and winning the race condition (TOCTOU) via the PrivilegedHelperTool component.

AAKL at 2024-07-22T14:41:08.036Z ##

Caro Networks has updated CVE-2023-43976, impacting #macOS Client v5.3.x https://support.catonetworks.com/hc/en-us/articles/14068076293789-Security-Vulnerability-CVE-2023-43976-that-Impacts-macOS-Client-v5-3-x @catonetworks #cybersecurity #infosec #Apple

(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-30T05:01:49

2 posts

Graphviz 2.36 before 10.0.0 has an out-of-bounds read via a crafted config6a file. NOTE: exploitability may be uncommon because this file is typically owned by root.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T19:59:39.088Z ##

VMware Cloud Foundation security advisory: USN-6708-1: Graphviz vulnerability
CVE-2023-46045 (7.8 high, disclosed 02 February 2024) Graphviz out of bounds read. (Note: VMware thinks it'll cause Denial of Service).
No mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-27198
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.16%

updated 2024-03-21T05:01:12

6 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 authentication bypass allowing to perform admin actions was possible

Nuclei template

10 repos

https://github.com/rampantspark/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/Shimon03/Explora-o-RCE-n-o-autenticado-JetBrains-TeamCity-CVE-2024-27198-

https://github.com/CharonDefalt/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/passwa11/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2024-27198-EXPLOIT

https://github.com/HPT-Intern-Task-Submission/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/Stuub/RCity-CVE-2024-27198

sleepycat at 2024-07-21T17:42:29.752Z ##

"Cloudflare observed exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-27198 (JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass) at 19:45 UTC on March 4, just 22 minutes after proof-of-concept code was published."

"The speed of exploitation of disclosed CVEs is often quicker than the speed at which humans can create WAF rules or create and deploy patches to mitigate attacks."

#cloudflare #ApplicationSecurity report

https://blog.cloudflare.com/application-security-report-2024-update

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T23:59:49.135Z ##

@vitriolix @campuscodi

Starting with JetBrains' security advisory on 04 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/ JetBrains was forced to publicly warn their customers that Rapid7 was going to imminently release Proofs of Concepts for the critical authentication bypass vulnerability.

The Rapid7's blog, released within an hour of JetBrains' advisory, does just that. The timeline tells you everything you need to know about how it went down: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

JetBrains, upset about the bad optics, releases "their side of the story" the next day: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/ In this blog, they readily admit to breaking protocol and refusing to do a coordinated vulnerability disclosure:

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

JetBrains, with their TeamCity customers under mass exploitation, doubles down and all but blames Rapid7 for releasing the PoCs in another blog post on 11 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/ They continue to insist on silent patching.

Since then, JetBrains has never published a security advisory in a blog post. You have to manually visit their Fixed security issues page to find CVE IDs. No other vendor takes over a week to identify the vulnerabilities and CVE IDs. If JetBrains didn't want the bad reputation, perhaps they should have written better code in the first place. Bug hunters who responsibly report these vulnerabilities are not the enemy here.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T15:40:17.783Z ##

JetBrains: TeamCity 2024.07 Is Here
I hate JetBrains but enough of you use TeamCity to report on this. TeamCity has a new version 2024.07 which came out today. Buried deep in their release notes is the only indication that any vulnerabilities were patched.

19 security problems have been fixed.

At this time of this toot, JetBrains' own Fixed security issues page is missing the 2024.07 dropdown option so they don't even identify any CVE IDs. A search for TeamCity on cve.mitre.org doesn't show any new CVEs since 01 July 2024.

Ever since JetBrains' feud with Rapid7 in March 2024, they are convinced that silent patching is the appropriate way to handle vulnerabilities. Now your customers don't even know why they should upgrade their TeamCity, or what n-day vulnerability they're being exploited with.

Patch your TeamCity. TeamCity vulnerabilities are known to be exploited by ransomware groups. cc: @campuscodi

#jetbrains #teamcity #vulnerability #cve

##
sleepycat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-21T17:42:29.000Z ##

"Cloudflare observed exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-27198 (JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass) at 19:45 UTC on March 4, just 22 minutes after proof-of-concept code was published."

"The speed of exploitation of disclosed CVEs is often quicker than the speed at which humans can create WAF rules or create and deploy patches to mitigate attacks."

#cloudflare #ApplicationSecurity report

https://blog.cloudflare.com/application-security-report-2024-update

##

CVE-2023-44467
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-02-26T19:54:46

2 posts

langchain_experimental 0.0.14 allows an attacker to bypass the CVE-2023-36258 fix and execute arbitrary code via the PALChain in the python exec method.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.337Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.000Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2008-0166
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 8.17%

updated 2024-02-18T05:07:33

4 posts

OpenSSL 0.9.8c-1 up to versions before 0.9.8g-9 on Debian-based operating systems uses a random number generator that generates predictable numbers, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct brute force guessing attacks against cryptographic keys.

4 repos

https://github.com/demining/Vulnerable-to-Debian-OpenSSL-bug-CVE-2008-0166

https://github.com/g0tmi1k/debian-ssh

https://github.com/avarx/vulnkeys

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl

kurtseifried at 2024-07-19T23:22:21.171Z ##

@postmodern Yup, posting here again:

Here's the thing:

The worst, most impactful Open Source security issue was...

log4j? Hardly any outages, the only big one I know of was Canada Revenue Agency (Canadian IRS basically) shutdown their website for a week right before tax deadline, and granted an extensions. But this is their well known emergency plan for dealking with critical software vulns that could result in their system getting hacked (e.g. previous incidents like HEARTBLEED: https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/heartbleed-bug-cyberattack-canada-government-departments-1.3355993)

SPECTRE and MELTDOWN perhaps? Some buggy updates were released that could brick systems (https://www.securityweek.com/hp-dell-halt-bios-updates-over-buggy-cpu-patches/) but obviously nothing on the scale of this CrowdStrike issue.

Debian's OpenSSL "oopsie" back in 2008 https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2008-0166 but I'll be darned if I ever found real reports of exploitation having an actual impact.

I feel like if we took EVERY major open source incident, balled them together, we still wouldn't have 1% of the disruption that Crowdstrike caused.

I would challenge anyone to find open source security bugs that had a major impact and reply here, hint: they're hard to find because most of them had very, very minimal public facing impacts.

##
kurtseifried at 2024-07-19T23:17:36.962Z ##

log4j? Hardly any outages, the only big one I know of was Canada Revenue Agency (Canadian IRS basically) shutdown their website for a week right before tax deadline, and granted an extensions. ##

CVE-2024-23652
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-09T01:44:27.827000

2 posts

BuildKit is a toolkit for converting source code to build artifacts in an efficient, expressive and repeatable manner. A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using RUN --mount could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5. Workarounds include avoiding using Buil

1 repos

https://github.com/abian2/CVE-2024-23652

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-07-26T18:06:03.000Z ##

This article discusses a critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-23652) in Docker Buildkit = v0.12.4, which allows arbitrary file deletion in the host OS

Mitigation involves updating to Buildkit v0.12.5 or later

➤ https://dev.to/snyk/buildkit-build-time-container-teardown-arbitrary-delete-cve-2024-23652-2kkh

##
kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-07-26T18:06:03.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-23651
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-02-09T01:43:51.767000

2 posts

BuildKit is a toolkit for converting source code to build artifacts in an efficient, expressive and repeatable manner. Two malicious build steps running in parallel sharing the same cache mounts with subpaths could cause a race condition that can lead to files from the host system being accessible to the build container. The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5. Workarounds include, avoiding using Buil

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-07-27T18:06:03.000Z ##

This article discusses a critical vulnerability in all versions of Docker Buildkit <=v0.12.4 that can result in container escape to the underlying host OS when building an image using a malicious Dockerfile or upstream image (i.e. when using `FROM`)

➤ https://dev.to/snyk/buildkit-mount-cache-race-build-time-race-condition-container-breakout-cve-2024-23651-7k0

##
kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-07-27T18:06:03.000Z ##

This article discusses a critical vulnerability in all versions of Docker Buildkit <=v0.12.4 that can result in container escape to the underlying host OS when building an image using a malicious Dockerfile or upstream image (i.e. when using `FROM`)

➤ https://dev.to/snyk/buildkit-mount-cache-race-build-time-race-condition-container-breakout-cve-2024-23651-7k0

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T14:47:25.315Z ##

Sygnia: The Return of Ghost Emperor's Demodex
A Chinese threat actor has been linked to a late 2023 attack that pivoted to the network of the victim's business partner. A variant of the Demodex rootkit was identified, associated with GhostEmperor. They are known to mainly target Southeast Asian telecommunications and government entities. While Sygnia mentions #ProxyLogon (CVE-2021-26855) as a previous initial access method, it does not elaborate and describes GhostEmperor's infection chain as using a batch file. Sygnia provides a technical analysis of the infection chain, and lists IOC.

h/t @therecord_media for the related reporting: ‘GhostEmperor’ returns: Mysterious Chinese hacking group spotted for first time in two years

#threatintel #ghostemperor #china #cyberespionage #IOC #CVE_2021_26855

CVE-2021-30869
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2023-11-07T03:33:37.040000

4 posts

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved state handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.5.5, iOS 14.4 and iPadOS 14.4, macOS Big Sur 11.2, Security Update 2021-001 Catalina, Security Update 2021-001 Mojave, Security Update 2021-006 Catalina. A malicious application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges. Apple is aware of reports that an exploit for this issue exists

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T13:06:54.055Z ##

Symantec: Daggerfly: Espionage Group Makes Major Update to Toolset
Chinese APT Evasive Panda (aka Daggerfly, BRONZE HIGHLAND) has updated their custom toolset and linked to attacks against Taiwanese organizations and a U.S. non-governmental organization (NGO) based in China. Annoyingly, Symantec mentioned a vulnerability in Apache HTTP server being exploited to deliver MgBot malware, but doesn't name the CVE ID (I scanned the whole blog post for mentions of Apache (1), HTTP (5), MgBot (10), and CVE (1) but it's not identified).

Macma is a macOS backdoor with two new variants discovered by Symantec. macOS users are targeted with CVE-2021-30869 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 September 2021 by Apple, added to CISA KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Apple type confusion to arbitrary code execution (privilege escalation) which allowed the attackers to install Macma on vulnerable systems.

Symantec also describes Evasive Panda using the Windows backdoor labeled Suzafk (aka Nightdoor, NetMM). "Symantec has seen evidence of the ability to Trojanize Android APKs, SMS interception tools, DNS request interception tools, and even malware families targeting Solaris OS." IOC provided.

#cyberespionage #evasivepanda #daggerfly #BronzeHighland #china #CVE_2021_30869 #mgbot #suzafk #nightdoor #netmm #macma #IOC #threatintel

##

Symantec also describes Evasive Panda using the Windows backdoor labeled Suzafk (aka Nightdoor, NetMM). "Symantec has seen evidence of the ability to Trojanize Android APKs, SMS interception tools, DNS request interception tools, and even malware families targeting Solaris OS." IOC provided.

(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.43%

updated 2023-11-07T03:28:59.363000

2 posts

A flaw was found in jackson-databind before 2.9.10.7. FasterXML mishandles the interaction between serialization gadgets and typing. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

##

CVE-2019-12814
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.54%

updated 2023-11-07T03:03:41.477000

2 posts

A Polymorphic Typing issue was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x through 2.9.9. When Default Typing is enabled (either globally or for a specific property) for an externally exposed JSON endpoint and the service has JDOM 1.x or 2.x jar in the classpath, an attacker can send a specifically crafted JSON message that allows them to read arbitrary local files on the server.

1 repos

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2019-12814

CVE-2023-36258
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.28%

updated 2023-11-05T05:01:32

2 posts

An issue in langchain allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via the PALChain in the python exec method.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.337Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.000Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2023-46229
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2023-10-25T14:56:07.537000

2 posts

LangChain before 0.0.317 allows SSRF via document_loaders/recursive_url_loader.py because crawling can proceed from an external server to an internal server.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.337Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

CVE-2017-17485
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 13.98%

updated 2023-06-08T18:00:10.447000

2 posts

FasterXML jackson-databind through 2.8.10 and 2.9.x through 2.9.3 allows unauthenticated remote code execution because of an incomplete fix for the CVE-2017-7525 deserialization flaw. This is exploitable by sending maliciously crafted JSON input to the readValue method of the ObjectMapper, bypassing a blacklist that is ineffective if the Spring libraries are available in the classpath.

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2017-17485

##

CVE-2020-5408
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:03

2 posts

Spring Security versions 5.3.x prior to 5.3.2, 5.2.x prior to 5.2.4, 5.1.x prior to 5.1.10, 5.0.x prior to 5.0.16 and 4.2.x prior to 4.2.16 use a fixed null initialization vector with CBC Mode in the implementation of the queryable text encryptor. A malicious user with access to the data that has been encrypted using such an encryptor may be able to derive the unencrypted values using a dictionary

neilmadden at 2024-07-17T17:26:46.503Z ##

@JPatONeil Almost every line of code in that package does something wrong from a crypto perspective:

  • they have unauthenticated CBC mode encryption as the “standard” option, which also silently uses a fixed zero IV so is completely insecure
  • one of the GCM implementations uses BouncyCastle’s “fast” table-lookup AES implementations, which likely has side-channels galore
  • the RSA encryption defaults to 1024-bit keys, which are not remotely secure by modern standards
  • it also defaults to PKCS#1 v1.5 padding, which is also not secure
  • the “raw” RSA implementation actually runs RSA in ECB mode if the message is longer than the modulus allows (quite likely given they use small keys). This is absolutely terrible.
  • the “secret” RSA encryption, which attempts to do hybrid encryption (with GCM), generates a random per-message AES key (good) but then treats it as a password and sends it through 1024 rounds of PBKDF2, so is incredibly slow. (It then pointlessly uses AES-256-GCM despite only generating a 128-bit key, again adding overhead for no security reason).

I’m sure there’s more that can be found by a more thorough review, that’s just the stuff that screams at me from 10 minutes looking at it. (And I’m pretty sure they only have GCM at all because I told them to add it years ago, as part of CVE-2020-5408).

Nobody with any crypto knowledge has been involved in developing that library, so why is it in a flagship framework?

##
neilmadden@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-17T17:26:46.000Z ##

@JPatONeil Almost every line of code in that package does something wrong from a crypto perspective:

  • they have unauthenticated CBC mode encryption as the “standard” option, which also silently uses a fixed zero IV so is completely insecure
  • one of the GCM implementations uses BouncyCastle’s “fast” table-lookup AES implementations, which likely has side-channels galore
  • the RSA encryption defaults to 1024-bit keys, which are not remotely secure by modern standards
  • it also defaults to PKCS#1 v1.5 padding, which is also not secure
  • the “raw” RSA implementation actually runs RSA in ECB mode if the message is longer than the modulus allows (quite likely given they use small keys). This is absolutely terrible.
  • the “secret” RSA encryption, which attempts to do hybrid encryption (with GCM), generates a random per-message AES key (good) but then treats it as a password and sends it through 1024 rounds of PBKDF2, so is incredibly slow. (It then pointlessly uses AES-256-GCM despite only generating a 128-bit key, again adding overhead for no security reason).

I’m sure there’s more that can be found by a more thorough review, that’s just the stuff that screams at me from 10 minutes looking at it. (And I’m pretty sure they only have GCM at all because I told them to add it years ago, as part of CVE-2020-5408).

Nobody with any crypto knowledge has been involved in developing that library, so why is it in a flagship framework?

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T15:25:30.626Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr

CVE-2017-9841
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

updated 2022-04-18T17:57:47.407000

2 posts

Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php in PHPUnit before 4.8.28 and 5.x before 5.6.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via HTTP POST data beginning with a "<?php " substring, as demonstrated by an attack on a site with an exposed /vendor folder, i.e., external access to the /vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php URI.

CVE-2024-39379
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-07-26T03:03:02.115Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories are in. See the parent toot above for the original Google Chrome blog post. The already disclosed CVE IDs go from 6988, 6989, 6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005 (16 total with no additional information). Then you have two new ones:

  • CVE-2024-38103 (5.9 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-39379 (7.0 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

These are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, and exploitation less likely. Also note that CVE-2024-38095 (7.5 high, disclosed 09 July 2024) .NET and Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability and .NET, .NET Framework, and CVE-2024-38081 (7.3 high, disclosed 09 July 2024) Visual Studio Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability received minor updates to add or remove additional vulnerable software.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38103 #CVE_2024_39379 #CVE

patchnow24x7 at 2024-07-22T02:58:27.893Z ##

CVE-2024-37381 : SQL Injection vulnerability in Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM).

Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.

Advisory:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-EPM-July-2024-for-EPM-2024?language=en_US

##
nydus@social.tchncs.de at 2024-07-19T14:01:41.000Z ##

Sicherheitslücke im Ivanti Endpoint Manager behoben: Ivanti warnt vor Schwachstelle im Endpoint Manager (EPM). Aktuell sind keine Angriffe bekannt. Dennoch sollten Admins ihre Systeme dringend absichern. Admins nutzen EPM zur Endgeräteverwaltung. Entwickler berichten in einem Beitrag, dass die Lücke (CVE-2024-37381 "hoch") in EPM 2024 flat besteht. Ob andere Versionen betroffen sind, bleibt unklar. Für künftige EPM-Versionen wird das Sicherheitsproblem behoben. https://nydus.org/news/131936-sicherheitslucke-im-ivanti-endpoint-manager-behoben.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T16:37:52.061Z ##

Ivanti security advisories! Blog: July Security Update

  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM): Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
    • CVE-2024-37381 (8.4) SQL Injection vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM): Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM) July 2024
    • CVE-2024-36130 (8.8 high) insufficient authorization vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36131 (8.8 high) insecure deserialization > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36132 (8.2 high) insufficient authentication verification > auth bypass and sensitive info disclosure
    • CVE-2024-34788 (5.3 medium) improper authentication > sensitive info disclosure
  • Ivanti Docs@Work for Android: Security Advisory CVE-2024-37403 (Dirty Stream) for Ivanti Docs@Work for Android
    • CVE-2024-37403 (5.0 medium) aka #DirtyStream path traversal (cc: @cR0w @reverseics) > sensitive info disclosure

We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild.

#Ivanti #CVE #epm #epmm #vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T19:23:02.043Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
CVE-2024-37381 (8.4 high) SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2024 flat to arbitrary code execution

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

2 weeks later, and 77.3% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 93.5% of Mastodon users.

It's been slow going this week. Still a few larger instances that need to patch. Maybe they've been busy rebooting Windows boxes to remove Crowdstrike. Take a break and patch your Mastodon instance.

#MastoAdmin #CVE202437903

marcellinusme@mastodon.social at 2024-07-19T09:33:28.000Z ##

@harld Was dat niet de kwetsbaarheid van het logfile van de Apache webserver? Of was het #DirtyPipe CVE-2022-0847 met de mogelijkheid een SSH key aan te maken en een Linux-server over te nemen?
In ieder geval zijn beide kwetsbaarheden na ontdekking snel opgelost door de open source community. Het was ook geen wereldwijde onberekenbare schade.

##
marcellinusme@mastodon.social at 2024-07-19T09:33:28.000Z ##

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T16:37:52.061Z ##

Ivanti security advisories! Blog: July Security Update

  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM): Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
    • CVE-2024-37381 (8.4) SQL Injection vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM): Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM) July 2024
    • CVE-2024-36130 (8.8 high) insufficient authorization vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36131 (8.8 high) insecure deserialization > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36132 (8.2 high) insufficient authentication verification > auth bypass and sensitive info disclosure
    • CVE-2024-34788 (5.3 medium) improper authentication > sensitive info disclosure
  • Ivanti Docs@Work for Android: Security Advisory CVE-2024-37403 (Dirty Stream) for Ivanti Docs@Work for Android
    • CVE-2024-37403 (5.0 medium) aka #DirtyStream path traversal (cc: @cR0w @reverseics) > sensitive info disclosure

We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild.

#Ivanti #CVE #epm #epmm #vulnerability
